clean_content:
Extramedullary hematopoiesis

Definition / general  

* Rarely associated with myeloproliferative disorders but also in healthy patients ([Diagn Cytopathol 1993;9:522](8287760), [Arch Otolaryngol 1982;108:523](7103832))

  
Case reports  

* 26 year old woman presented with modified Bloom Richardson grade 2 invasive ductal carcinoma and ipsilateral axillary lymph node metastasis at diagnosis; her cancer was hormone receptor positive, HER2 equivocal (2+) on IHC ([Case of the month #537](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case537.htm))

  
Microscopic (histologic) images  
  
Contributed by Nikhil Sangle, M.D., Sherif Shabaan, M.D. and Julie M. Jorns, M.D. ([Case #537](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case537.htm))  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesEMHsangle01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesEMHsangle01.jpg)
 
[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesEMHsangle02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesEMHsangle02.jpg)

Liver with extramedullary hematopoiesis

[![H&E SLN capsule and parenchyma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case537img1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case537img1.jpg)

H&E SLN capsule and parenchyma

[![H&E Another region of the SLN](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case537img2.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case537img2.jpg)

H&E Another region of the SLN

[![Metastatic carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case537img4.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case537img4.jpg)

Metastatic carcinoma

[![Cytokeratin AE1 / AE3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case537img3.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case537img3.jpg)

Cytokeratin AE1 / AE3

  
  
Differential diagnosis  

* [Hodgkin lymphoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphomanonBclassic.html)

Megakaryocytes

Definition / general  

* Often associated with extramedullary hematopoiesis when present in lymph nodes

  
Case reports  

* 35 year old woman with megakaryocytes mimicking metastatic breast carcinoma ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2002;126:618](11958674))

  
Microscopic (histologic) images  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodesmegakaryocytes_udel01.gif)](http://www.udel.edu/biology/Wags/histopage/colorpage/ch/chmk1.GIF)

Megakaryocytes in bone marrow

  
  
Positive stains  

* [CD31](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd31.html), [CD61](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd61.html), [vWF](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsvwf.html)

  
Negative stains  

* [Keratin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsckgeneral.html), [CD68](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd68.html)

  
Differential diagnosis  

* **Multinucleated histiocytes**:
  + Larger, more cytoplasm, vesicular nuclei that are not multilobated+ [CD68](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd68.html)+

Müllerian inclusions

Definition / general

* Benign glandular inclusions lined by salpingeal or ovarian epithelium with no endometrial stroma or hemosiderophages

  
Terminology

* Also called endosalpingiosis

  
Sites

* Predominantly pelvic and paraaortic lymph nodes* Present in 5 - 41% of intra-abdominal nodes of women, 20% of women with gynecologic malignancies in paraaortic / pelvic nodes ([Am J Obstet Gynecol 1978;130:813](637105), [Gynecol Oncol 2000;78:242](10926810))

  
Pathophysiology

* Theories include:
  + Passage of epithelial cells through the tubal ostium for implantation in the peritoneum following peeling, followed by transportation by the lymphatic route to reach the pelvic lymph node+ Metaplastic origin from the peritoneum+ Foci of endometriosis+ Vestiges of paramesonephricus ducts+ Metastases from ovarian serous borderline tumors ([Am J Surg Pathol 2000;24:710](10800990))

  
Clinical features

* Incidental finding / enlarged lymph nodes

  
Case reports

* 64 year old woman with endosalpingiosis with psammoma bodies within an intramammary lymph node presented as microcalcifications on mammography ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 1995;119:841](7668944))* Coexisting with breast metastatic carcinoma in an axillary lymph node ([Virchows Arch 2005;446:467](15785927))

  
Treatment

* Benign process, with no clinical significance

  
Gross description

* Enlarged lymph nodes

  
Microscopic (histologic) description

* Glandular / cystic inclusions lined by cuboidal / columnar cells with a Müllerian or coelomic appearance commonly found in the capsule* Psammoma bodies are common* May undergo squamous metaplasia* No / rare mitotic figures, no / mild atypia, no desmoplastic stroma, no endometrial stroma

  
Microscopic (histologic) images  
  
AFIP images  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_062.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_062.jpg)

In pelvic lymph node

  
  
Positive stains

* [Keratin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsckgeneral.html), [mucin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmucins.html)

  
Differential diagnosis

* [Metastasis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesmetastases.html) from borderline / malignant ovarian tumors or uterine carcinomas

  
Additional references

* [J Clin Oncol 2006;24:2013](16606970), [Ioachim: Ioachim's Lymph Node Pathology, 4th Edition, 2008](http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0781775965/pathologyoutl-20), [Rosai: Rosai and Ackerman's Surgical Pathology, 10th Edition, 2011](http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/032306969X/pathologyoutl-20), [Robboy: Robboy's Pathology of the Female Reproductive Tract, 2nd Edition, 2008](http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0443074771/pathologyoutl-20), [Dunphy: Frozen Section Library - Lymph Nodes, 2012](http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/1461412528/pathologyoutl-20), [Weiss: Lymph Nodes, 1st Edition, 2008](http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0521871611/pathologyoutl-20), [University of Pittsburgh: Endometriosis and Bland Glandular Inclusions [Accessed 12 April 2023]](http://path.upmc.edu/cases/case375/dx.html)

Nevus cells

Definition / general  

* Incidence in axillary nodes is 7% per patient and 0.5% per node in one study ([Am J Clin Pathol 1994;102:102](8037154))* Presence in sentinel nodes in melanoma patients is associated with
    + Cutaneous nevi ([Am J Clin Pathol 2004;121:58](14750241))+ Congenital cutaneous nevi ([Am J Dermatopathol 2002;24:1](11803273))* May represent benign metastases from intradermal nevus in area of lymphatic drainage ([Am J Clin Pathol 1985;84:220](4025228))

  
Microscopic (histologic) description  

* Single cells, linear arrangements or aggregates of small, round / oval nevus cells with moderate pale / clear cytoplasm, round nuclei with fine chromatin, no prominent nucleoli or pleomorphism, usually within fibrous capsule and trabeculae but also within nodal parenchyma or surrounding a small vessel ([Am J Surg Pathol 2003;27:673](12717252), [Am J Surg Pathol 1996;20:834](8669531))

  
Microscopic (histologic) images  
  
Contributed by Debra L. Zynger, M.D.  

[![Nests within capsule](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro01.jpg)

Nests within capsule

[![Bland cells](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro02.jpg)

Bland cells

[![SOX10](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro03.jpg)

SOX10

[![S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro04.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro04.jpg)

S100

[![AE1/3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro05.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodesnevimicro05.jpg)

AE1/3

  
  
Positive stains  

* [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html), [MART1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmart1.html), [tyrosinase](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainstyrosinase.html), [p16](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsp16.html) ([Virchows Arch 2003;443:745](14576937))

  
Negative stains  

* [HMB45](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainshmb45.html) (occasionally is very focal), [Ki-67](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainski67.html) (< 1%, [Am J Surg Pathol 2002;26:1351](12360050))

  
Differential diagnosis  

* [Blue nevus](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/skintumormelanocyticbluenevus.html):
  + Also spindled / dendritic cells with heavy pigmentation* [Metastatic carcinoma or melanoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesmetastases.html):
    + Usually not confined to capsule, atypia, mitotic figures, different immunostaining* [Spitz nevus](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/skintumormelanocyticspitz.html):
      + Larger cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm+ Vesicular nuclei with prominent nucleoli

Salivary gland

Definition / general

* Benign salivary gland structures in lymph nodes* Includes ducts and acini

  
Terminology

* Salivary gland inclusions* Ectopic salivary tissue* Heterotropic salivary gland tissue

  
Epidemiology

* Common incidental finding

  
Sites

* Most common in upper cervical lymph nodes* Rarely - thoracic, mediastinal lymph nodes

  
Pathophysiology

* Considered a normal event related to the embryology of the region

  
Clinical features

* None - incidental finding* Enlarged lymph nodes

  
Prognostic factors

* Benign with no significance* May undergo diseases of salivary glands including neoplastic processes - Warthin tumor is most common tumor

  
Case reports

* 55 year old woman with sialometaplasia arising in ectopic salivary gland ductal inclusions ([J Clin Pathol 2004;57:1335](15563681))* 60 year old man with salivary gland tissue in cervical lymph nodes ([Laryngorhinootologie 2007;86:44](16586289))* 68 year old woman with benign salivary gland tissue inclusion in a pulmonary hilar lymph node ([Int J Surg Pathol 2011;19:382](21087984))* Proliferative sialometaplasia arising in an intraparotid lymph node ([Am J Clin Pathol 1986;86:116](3014860))

  
Treatment

* Usually none but may be indicated based on clinical situation

  
Clinical images  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodessalivaryglandinclusionsthumbimg01.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1770497/figure/f1/)

Circumscribed mass lesions due to  
sialometaplasia arising in ectopic  
salivary gland ductal inclusions

  
  
Gross description

* Normal / enlarged lymph nodes

  
Microscopic (histologic) description

* Both ducts and acini are usually present* Benign ducts are lined by double layer of epithelium and myoepithelium* Benign acini have zymogen granules

  
Microscopic (histologic) images  
  
AFIP images  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_063.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_063.jpg)

Salivary gland inclusion in lymph node

  
  
*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodessalivaryglandinclusionsthumbimg02.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1770497/figure/f2/)
 
[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodessalivaryglandinclusionsthumbimg03.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1770497/figure/f3/)

Inclusions undergoing sialometaplasia show extensive squamous metaplasia

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodessalivaryglandinclusionsthumbimg04.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1770497/figure/f4/)

Inclusions with sialometaplasia: SMA

  
  
Differential diagnosis

* [Metastatic adenocarcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesmetastases.html#adenocarcinoma)

  
Additional references

* [Arch Pathol Lab Med 2003;127:e25](12562290), [Jaffe: Hematopathology, 1st Edition, 2010](http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0721600409/pathologyoutl-20), [Rosai: Rosai and Ackerman's Surgical Pathology, 10th Edition, 2011](http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/032306969X/pathologyoutl-20)

Smooth muscle

Definition / general

* Topic discusses the presence of smooth muscle within the capsule and hilum of normal lymph nodes* Common, incidental finding in lymph nodes of hilar smooth muscle proliferation, more commonly in males than females ([Virchows Arch A Pathol Anat Histopathol 1985;406:261](3923702))

  
Sites

* Superficial, inguinal and axillary lymph nodes are most commonly involved

  
Etiology

* Suggested etiological factors include back pressure in efferent lymphatics, local inflammation

  
Clinical features

* Asymptomatic, with no apparent clinical significance, but may have enlarged lymph nodes

  
Diagnosis

* Biopsy* Immunohistochemistry for smooth muscle to confirm

  
Case reports

* 6 year old boy with intranodal leiomyoma ([Pediatr Dev Pathol 2014;17:118](24555426))

  
Gross description

* Enlarged lymph nodes with firm, tan cut surface

  
Microscopic (histologic) description

* Nodal architecture is well preserved* Muscle fibers run parallel to capsule or hilar blood vessels* Varied patterns of hilar changes:
      + Smooth muscle fibers may be densely interwoven within fibrous tissue and hug the hilar nodal capsule+ Smooth muscle fibers may form a loose network extending in all directions within hilar adipose tissue+ Smooth muscle may surround individual islands of fat cells

  
Microscopic (histologic) images  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodessmoothmuscle_nih01.png)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21139904/#&gid=article-figures&pid=figure-1-uid-0)

Angiomyomatous hamartoma of lymph node

  
  
Positive stains

* [Smooth muscle actin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalphasmoothmuscleactin.html), [desmin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsdesmin.html), [muscle specific actin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsactinmusclespecific.html)

  
Negative stains

* [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html)

  
Differential diagnosis

* [Angiomyomatous hamartoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesangiomyomatoushamartoma.html) ([Korean J Path 2011;45:S58](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/276234239_Angiomyomatous_Hamartoma_of_Popliteal_Lymph_Nodes_Occurring_in_Association_with_Diffuse_Pigmented_Villonodular_Synovitis_of_Knee))* [Benign metastasizing leiomyoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/uterusleiomyoma.html#benignmetastasizingleiomyoma)* [Inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissueinflammyofibro.html)* **Intranodal leiomyoma*** [Lymphangioleiomyomatosis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodeslymphangiomyomatosis.html)* [Pallisading myofibroblastoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesmyofibroblastoma.html)* [Vascular transformation of lymph node sinuses](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesvasculartransformationofsinuses.html)

  
Additional references

* [Anat Rec 1975;183:517](1200408), [J Cell Biol 2012;197:837](22665518), [Ioachim: Ioachim's Lymph Node Pathology, 4th Edition, 2008](http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0781775965/pathologyoutl-20)

Squamous epithelium

Definition / general  

* Also called lymphoepithelial cyst* Most common in upper cervical nodes* Depending on location, may be a branchial pouch derivative or derive from metaplastic calyceal urothelium ([Hum Pathol 1990;21:1239](2174402))

  
Case reports  

* 33 and 64 year old women with benign heterotopic epithelial inclusions in axillary lymph nodes ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2003;127:e25](12562290))* 48 year old woman with axillary intranodal cysts associated with breast malignancy ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2004;128:361](14987141))* 57 and 75 year old women with cystic lymphoepithelial lesions of peripancreatic nodes ([Surg Today 1999;29:467](10333422))* Epithelial inclusion in axillary lymph node associated with a breast carcinoma ([Pathol Res Pract 1999;195:263](10337666))

  
Microscopic (histologic) description  

* Small cystic structures lined by well differentiated squamous epithelium

  
Differential diagnosis  

* [Metastatic well differentiated squamous cell carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesmetastases.html#scc):
  + Often undergoes cystic change

Thymus

Definition / general  

* Ectopic thymus may be present in supraclavicular nodes

  
Microscopic (histologic) description  

* Lymphoid stroma with Hassall corpuscles

  
Differential diagnosis  

* [Metastatic squamous cell carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesmetastases.html#scc)
